wikipedia_page.main: Anthony Karalius (19 September 1943 – 29 November 2019) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Widnes, St Helens, Wigan, Fulham RLFC and the Cardiff City Blue Dragons, as a hooker during the era of contested scrums.

response: * Tony Karalius (1943 in Widnes – 2019) rugby league footballer, 394 games mainly for St. Helens
